identificationModule.briefTitle: Efficacy and Safety of Increasing Doses of Inhaled Albuterol in Children With Acute Wheezing Episodes
identificationModule.officialTitle: Efficacy and Safety of Increasing Doses of Inhaled Albuterol Administered by Metered Dose Inhalers in Children With Acute Wheezing Episodes

responsibleParty.investigatorFullName: Luiz Vicente Ribeiro Ferreira da Silva Filho

collaborators.name: Fundação de Amparo à Pesquisa do Estado de São Paulo

descriptionModule.briefSummary: Metered dose inhalers with spacers are devices capable of providing higher rates of lung deposition of drugs such as beta agonists when compared to conventional nebulizers, but there is no consensus about the optimal dose when this is the device of choice and there is evidence that younger children need proportionally higher doses of albuterol (in μg/kg) when compared to older children. Other factors that may interfere with response to albuterol treatment include the genetics of the beta adrenergic receptor (ADRβ2) and infectious etiology of the wheezing attack. This study will assess the effectiveness of a dose regimen that prioritizes higher doses of albuterol, with doses in μg/kg higher for younger children. Security of this new dosing regimen will be assessed by monitoring clinical side effects and serum levels of albuterol, but the investigators will also examine the presence of 12 different respiratory viruses in these patients and evaluate the influence of ADRβ2 receptor genetics in the response to albuterol. The primary outcome measure will be the need for hospitalization. Secondary outcomes will include a change in clinical score, respiratory rate and forced expiratory volume in the first second, the need for additional treatments and length of stay in the emergency room for those not hospitalized.
descriptionModule.detailedDescription:
This is a prospective, randomized, double blinded, controlled study. The patients will be randomly assigned to one of the treatment groups (experimental or control groups).

The patients will be assessed 1 hour later and every 30 minutes thereafter until discharge. Following 4 hours in the emergency room, any patient who do not meet the discharge criteria (PRAM score ≤ 3 and SpO2 ≥ 92%) will be admitted to the hospital. Each patient's attending physician will determine the need for additional therapies following the first hour.

Identification of respiratory viruses in the nasal lavage samples wil be performed using the CLART PneumoVir® kit.

Albuterol plasmatic levels will be analyzed via HPLC (High Performance Liquid Chromatography).

To genotype the ADBR2 receptor (blood samples), the gene regions encompassing the Arg16Gly, Gln27Glu, and Arg19Cys Thr164Ile polymorphisms will be amplified via PCR. The resultant amplimers were then sequenced.

A sample of 124 patients (62 in each group) was calculated to provide an 80% power with which to detect a significant difference of at least 30 minutes in the lengths of stay between the groups. The chi-square test will be used to compare hospital admission rates and tremor rates. For all other outcomes, t-tests for mean comparisons (variables with a normal distribution), a Mann Whitney test (nonparametric data) and ANOVA with repeated measures will be used.

armGroups.label: Albuterol - Experimental
armGroups.description: Albuterol dosages during the first hour include 900 mcg (up to 15 kg), 1200 mcg (\> 15 to 20 kg), 1500 mcg (\> 20 to 25 kg) and 1800 mcg (\> 25 kg).

armGroups.label: Albuterol - Control
armGroups.description: Albuterol dosages during the first hour include either 600 mcg (up to 25 kg) or 1200 mcg (\> 25 kg).

interventions.name: Albuterol - Experimental
interventions.description: The Experimental group will receive higher doses of albuterol in the first hour: 900 mcg (up to 15 kg), 1200 mcg (\> 15 to 20 kg), 1500 mcg (\> 20 to 25 kg) and 1800 mcg (\> 25 kg).

interventions.name: Albuterol - Control
interventions.description: The Control group will receive the following doses of albuterol in the first hour 600 mcg (up to 25 kg) or 1200 mcg (\> 25 kg)

primaryOutcomes.description: Hospital admission was defined as the need to stay in the emergency room for more than 4 hours, due to the failure to meet the discharge criteria (PRAM score ≤ 3 and pulse oximetry, ≥ 92%)

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Forced Expiratory Volume in the First Second
secondaryOutcomes.description: Change in FEV1 one hour post-treatment in comparison with baseline. Spirometry was performed only in subjects older than 6 years and who could perform the maneuver properly.
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: One hour post-treatment in comparison with baseline

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Change in PRAM Score After One Hour
secondaryOutcomes.description:
Change in the Pediatric Respiratory Assessment Measure (PRAM) score one hour post-treatment in comparison with baseline.

The PRAM score is used to assess the severity of asthma attacks, it ranges from 0 to 15, and the higher the score, the greater the severity of the attack.

We calculated the difference between the PRAM score measured one hour post treatment and the PRAM score at baseline (PRAM score 1 hour - PRAM score baseline).

The larger the absolute value of the difference, the better the outcome (e.g., a difference of -4 indicates a better outcome that a difference of -2).

minimum value of the difference (Albuterol - Higher Dose, experimental group): -8 maximum value of the difference (Albuterol - Higher Dose, experimental group): 0

minimum value of the difference (Albuterol - Lower Dose, control group): -8 maximum value of the difference (Albuterol - Lower Dose, control group): 0
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: One hour post-treatment

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Albuterol Determination in the Plasma
secondaryOutcomes.description: Albuterol determination in the plasma was carried out at at discharge or hospital admission (up to 4 hours post treatment), dosage was accomplished by High Performance Liquid Chromatography.
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: at discharge or admission (up to 4 hours post treatment, minimum 1 hour, maximum 4 hours post treatment)

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Changes in Glucose Serum Levels
secondaryOutcomes.description: Changes in glucose serum levels at discharge or hospital admission (up to 4 hours post treatment) in comparison with baseline.
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: at discharge or admission (up to 4 hours post treatment, minimum 1 hour, maximum 4 hours post treatment) in comparison with baseline.

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Electrocardiogram at Baseline
secondaryOutcomes.description: Electrocardiogram performed at baseline
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: at baseline

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Changes in Respiratory Rate After One Hour
secondaryOutcomes.description: Change in respiratory rate one hour post-treatment in comparison with baseline.
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: One hour post-treatment in comparison with baseline

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Need for Additional Therapies
secondaryOutcomes.description: The need for additional therapies such as magnesium sulphate or intravenous albuterol were recorded
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: at discharge or admission (up to 4 hours post treatment, minimum 1 hour, maximum 4 hours post treatment)

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Changes in PRAM Score at Discharge or Hospital Admission
secondaryOutcomes.description:
Change in the Pediatric Respiratory Assessment Measure (PRAM) score at discharge or hospital admission (up to 4 hours post treatment) in comparison with baseline.

The PRAM score is used to assess the severity of asthma attacks, it ranges from 0 to 15, and the higher the score, the greater the severity of the attack.

We calculated the difference between the PRAM score measured at discharge or admission and the PRAM score at baseline (PRAM score discharge or admission - PRAM score baseline).

The larger the absolute value of the difference, the better the outcome (e.g., a difference of -4 indicates a better outcome that a difference of -2).

minimum value of the difference (Albuterol - Higher Dose, experimental group): -9 maximum value of the difference (Albuterol - Higher Dose, experimental group): 0

minimum value of the difference (Albuterol - Lower Dose, control group): -9 maximum value of the difference (Albuterol - Lower Dose, control group): 1
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: at discharge or admission (up to 4 hours post treatment, minimum 1 hour, maximum 4 hours post treatment) in comparison with baseline.

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Changes in Potassium Serum Levels
secondaryOutcomes.description: Changes in potassium serum levels at discharge or hospital admission (up to 4 hours post treatment) in comparison with baseline.
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: at discharge or admission (up to 4 hours post treatment, minimum 1 hour, maximum 4 hours post treatment) in comparison with baseline.

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Changes in Bicarbonate Serum Levels
secondaryOutcomes.description: Changes in bicarbonate serum levels at discharge or hospital admission (up to 4 hours post treatment) in comparison with baseline.
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: at discharge or admission (up to 4 hours post treatment, minimum 1 hour, maximum 4 hours post treatment) in comparison with baseline.

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Changes in Respiratory Rate at at Discharge or Hospital Admission.
secondaryOutcomes.description: Changes in respiratory rate at discharge or hospital admission (up to 4 hours post treatment) in comparison with baseline.
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: at discharge or admission (up to 4 hours post treatment, minimum 1 hour, maximum 4 hours post treatment) in comparison with baseline.

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Change in Pulse Oximetry One Hour Post-treatment
secondaryOutcomes.description: Change in pulse oximetry one hour post-treatment in comparison with baseline
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: One hour post-treatment in comparison with baseline

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Changes in Pulse Oximetry at Discharge or Hospital Admission.
secondaryOutcomes.description: Changes in pulse oximetry at discharge or hospital admission (up to 4 hours post treatment) in comparison with baseline.
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: at discharge or admission (up to 4 hours post treatment, minimum 1 hour, maximum 4 hours post treatment) in comparison with baseline.

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Changes in Heart Rate After One Hour
secondaryOutcomes.description: Change in heart rate one hour post-treatment in comparison with baseline.
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: One hour post-treatment in comparison with baseline

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Changes in Heart Rate at Discharge or Hospital Admission
secondaryOutcomes.description: Changes in heart rate at discharge or hospital admission (up to 4 hours post treatment) in comparison with baseline.
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: at discharge or admission (up to 4 hours post treatment, minimum 1 hour, maximum 4 hours post treatment)

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Electrocardiogram One Hour Post-treatment.
secondaryOutcomes.description: Electrocardiogram one hour post-treatment to identify possible rhythm disturbances.
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: One hour post-treatment

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Electrocardiogram at Discharge or Hospital Admission
secondaryOutcomes.description: Electrocardiogram at discharge or hospital admission to identify possible rhythm disturbances.
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: at discharge or admission (up to 4 hours post treatment, minimum 1 hour, maximum 4 hours post treatment)

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Lengths of Stay in the Emergency Room
secondaryOutcomes.description: lengths of stay in the emergency room for discharged patients
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: one to four hours

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Admission Rates in Patients With and Without Any Virus Detected
secondaryOutcomes.description: Admission rates in patients with and without any of the following viruses detected by PCR in nasal lavage samples: Adenovirus; Bocavirus; Coronavirus; Enterovirus (Echovirus); Influenza (A H3N2, A H1N1/2009, B and C); Metapneumovirus (subtypes A and B); Parainfluenza 1, 2, 3 and 4 (subtypes A and B); Rhinovirus; Respiratory Syncytial Virus type A and Respiratory Syncytial Virus type B.
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: at discharge or admission (up to 4 hours post treatment, minimum 1 hour, maximum 4 hours post treatment)

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Admission Rates in Patients With and Without Rhinovirus Detect
secondaryOutcomes.description: Admission rates in patients with and without rhinovirus detected by PCR in nasal lavage samples.
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: at discharge or admission (up to 4 hours post treatment, minimum 1 hour, maximum 4 hours post treatment)

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Admission Rates in Patients With the Arg16Gly Polymorphisms
secondaryOutcomes.description: Admission rates in patients with the Arg16Gly polymorphisms of the beta-2 adrenergic receptor (Arg16Gly, Arg16Arg and Gly16Gly genotypes).
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: at discharge or admission (up to 4 hours post treatment, minimum 1 hour, maximum 4 hours post treatment)

references.citation: Muchao FP, Souza AV, Souza JME, Silva Filho LVRFD. Association between beta-2 adrenergic receptor variants and clinical outcomes in children and adolescents with acute asthma. Einstein (Sao Paulo). 2022 Mar 25;20:eAO6412. doi: 10.31744/einstein_journal/2022AO6412. eCollection 2022.

Muchao FP, Souza JM, Torres HC, De Lalibera IB, de Souza AV, Rodrigues JC, Schvartsman C, da Silva Filho LV. Albuterol via metered-dose inhaler in children: Lower doses are effective, and higher doses are safe. Pediatr Pulmonol. 2016 Nov;51(11):1122-1130. doi: 10.1002/ppul.23469. Epub 2016 May 12.

groups.title: Albuterol - Higher Dose (Experimental)
groups.description:
Dosing will be individualized in four categories according to body weight

Albuterol - Experimental: The Experimental group will receive higher doses of albuterol in the first hour: up to 15 kg of weight: 900 mcg; 15 to 20 kg: 1200 mcg; 20 to 25 kg: 1500; more than 25 kg: 1800 mcg

groups.title: Albuterol - Lower Dose (Control)
groups.description:
Dosing will be dived according to consensus recommendations in only two categories according to body weight

Albuterol - Control: The Control group will receive 600 mcg for those with weight under 25kg and 1200 mcg for those grater than 25 kg

groups.title: Experimental Group
groups.description:
Dosing will be individualized in four categories according to body weight

Albuterol - Experimental: The Experimental group will receive higher doses of albuterol in the first hour: up to 15 kg of weight: 900 mcg; 15 to 20 kg: 1200 mcg; 20 to 25 kg: 1500; more than 25 kg: 1800 mcg

groups.title: Control Group
groups.description:
Dosing will be dived according to consensus recommendations in only two categories according to body weight

Albuterol - Control: The Control group will receive 600 mcg for those with weight under 25kg and 1200 mcg for those grater than 25 kg

groups.title: Total
groups.description: Total of all reporting groups

outcomeMeasures.title: Albuterol Determination in the Plasma
outcomeMeasures.description: Albuterol determination in the plasma was carried out at at discharge or hospital admission (up to 4 hours post treatment), dosage was accomplished by High Performance Liquid Chromatography.
outcomeMeasures.populationDescription: It was possible to obtain albuterol plasma levels from 52 patients in the study group and 51 in the control group (in the other samples, this analysis was not feasible due to hemolysis).
outcomeMeasures.timeFrame: at discharge or admission (up to 4 hours post treatment, minimum 1 hour, maximum 4 hours post treatment)

outcomeMeasures.title: Changes in PRAM Score at Discharge or Hospital Admission
outcomeMeasures.description:
Change in the Pediatric Respiratory Assessment Measure (PRAM) score at discharge or hospital admission (up to 4 hours post treatment) in comparison with baseline.

The PRAM score is used to assess the severity of asthma attacks, it ranges from 0 to 15, and the higher the score, the greater the severity of the attack.

We calculated the difference between the PRAM score measured at discharge or admission and the PRAM score at baseline (PRAM score discharge or admission - PRAM score baseline).

The larger the absolute value of the difference, the better the outcome (e.g., a difference of -4 indicates a better outcome that a difference of -2).

minimum value of the difference (Albuterol - Higher Dose, experimental group): -9 maximum value of the difference (Albuterol - Higher Dose, experimental group): 0

minimum value of the difference (Albuterol - Lower Dose, control group): -9 maximum value of the difference (Albuterol - Lower Dose, control group): 1
outcomeMeasures.timeFrame: at discharge or admission (up to 4 hours post treatment, minimum 1 hour, maximum 4 hours post treatment) in comparison with baseline.

outcomeMeasures.timeFrame: at discharge or admission (up to 4 hours post treatment, minimum 1 hour, maximum 4 hours post treatment) in comparison with baseline.

groups.title: Albuterol - Higher Dose (Experimental)
groups.description:
Dosing will be individualized in four categories according to body weight

Albuterol - Experimental: The Experimental group will receive higher doses of albuterol in the first hour: up to 15 kg of weight: 900 mcg; 15 to 20 kg: 1200 mcg; 20 to 25 kg: 1500; more than 25 kg: 1800 mcg

groups.title: Albuterol - Lower Dose (Control)
groups.description:
Dosing will be dived according to consensus recommendations in only two categories according to body weight

Albuterol - Control: The Control group will receive 600 mcg for those with weight under 25kg and 1200 mcg for those grater than 25 kg

outcomeMeasures.title: Electrocardiogram One Hour Post-treatment.
outcomeMeasures.description: Electrocardiogram one hour post-treatment to identify possible rhythm disturbances.
outcomeMeasures.populationDescription: No electrocardiographic abnormalities were detected im both groups
outcomeMeasures.timeFrame: One hour post-treatment

outcomeMeasures.title: Electrocardiogram at Discharge or Hospital Admission
outcomeMeasures.description: Electrocardiogram at discharge or hospital admission to identify possible rhythm disturbances.
outcomeMeasures.populationDescription: No electrocardiographic abnormalities were detected in both groups.
outcomeMeasures.timeFrame: at discharge or admission (up to 4 hours post treatment, minimum 1 hour, maximum 4 hours post treatment)

outcomeMeasures.title: Lengths of Stay in the Emergency Room
outcomeMeasures.description: lengths of stay in the emergency room for discharged patients
outcomeMeasures.timeFrame: one to four hours

outcomeMeasures.title: Admission Rates in Patients With and Without Any Virus Detected
outcomeMeasures.description: Admission rates in patients with and without any of the following viruses detected by PCR in nasal lavage samples: Adenovirus; Bocavirus; Coronavirus; Enterovirus (Echovirus); Influenza (A H3N2, A H1N1/2009, B and C); Metapneumovirus (subtypes A and B); Parainfluenza 1, 2, 3 and 4 (subtypes A and B); Rhinovirus; Respiratory Syncytial Virus type A and Respiratory Syncytial Virus type B.
outcomeMeasures.populationDescription: We obtained nasal lavage samples from 117 individuals, in two patients it was not possible to collect nasal lavage samples.
outcomeMeasures.timeFrame: at discharge or admission (up to 4 hours post treatment, minimum 1 hour, maximum 4 hours post treatment)

groups.title: Virus Detected
groups.description: patients with any virus detected by PCR

groups.title: No Virus Detected
groups.description: patients with no virus detected by PCR

outcomeMeasures.title: Admission Rates in Patients With and Without Rhinovirus Detect
outcomeMeasures.description: Admission rates in patients with and without rhinovirus detected by PCR in nasal lavage samples.
outcomeMeasures.populationDescription: We obtained nasal lavage samples from 117 individuals, in two patients it was not possible to collect nasal lavage samples.
outcomeMeasures.timeFrame: at discharge or admission (up to 4 hours post treatment, minimum 1 hour, maximum 4 hours post treatment)

groups.title: Rhinovirus Detected
groups.description: patients with rhinovirus detected by PCR

groups.title: No Rhinovirus Detected
groups.description: patients with no rhinovirus detected by PCR

outcomeMeasures.title: Admission Rates in Patients With the Arg16Gly Polymorphisms
outcomeMeasures.description: Admission rates in patients with the Arg16Gly polymorphisms of the beta-2 adrenergic receptor (Arg16Gly, Arg16Arg and Gly16Gly genotypes).
outcomeMeasures.populationDescription: The sequencing of the beta-2 adrenergic receptor gene was performed in a subset of 60 patients, in the other samples these analysis were not feasible due to hemolysis.
outcomeMeasures.timeFrame: at discharge or admission (up to 4 hours post treatment, minimum 1 hour, maximum 4 hours post treatment)

groups.title: Arg16Gly Patients
groups.description: Patients carrying the Arg16Gly genotype

groups.title: Gly16Gly Patients
groups.description: Patients carrying the Gly16Gly genotype

groups.title: Arg16Arg Patients
groups.description: Patients carrying the Arg16Arg genotype

adverseEventsModule.timeFrame: At discharge or hospital admission (up to 4 hours post treatment, minimum 1 hour, maximum 4 hours post-baseline).
adverseEventsModule.description:
At discharge or hospital admission (up to 4 hours post-baseline, minimum 1 hour, maximum 4 hours) all possible adverse effects were monitored: significant changes in potassium and glucose and bicarbonate serum levels, electrocardiographic abnormalities or any clinical adverse effect.

The last adverse event was detected 4 hours post-treatment.

eventGroups.title: Experimental Group
eventGroups.description:
Dosing was individualized in four categories according to body weight

Albuterol - Experimental: The Experimental group received higher doses of albuterol in the first hour: up to 15 kg of weight: 900 mcg; 15 to 20 kg: 1200 mcg; 20 to 25 kg: 1500; more than 25 kg: 1800 mcg

eventGroups.title: Control Group
eventGroups.description:
Dosing was dived according to consensus recommendations in only two categories according to body weight

Albuterol - Control: The Control group received 600 mcg for those with weight under 25kg and 1200 mcg for those grater than 25 kg

otherEvents.term: non symptomatic mild hypokalemia at discharge or hospital admission (up to 4 hours post-baseline).
otherEvents.notes:
Non symptomatic mild hypokalemia in 17 patients, 10 in the control group, 7 in the experimental group.

Only 2 patients showed values below 3.1 mEq/L. One patient in the experimental group: 2.8 mEq/L. One patient in the control group: 2.9mEq/L

otherEvents.term: non symptomatic mild hyperglycemia at discharge or hospital admission (up to 4 hours post-baseline)
otherEvents.notes:
Non symptomatic mild hyperglycemia at discharge or hospital admission (up to 4 hours post treatment, minimum 1 hour, maximum 4 hours post treatment).

No patients needed medical intervention.

limitationsAndCaveats.description: The inclusion of a larger number of patients in this study may have uncovered differences in the efficacy outcomes studied between the groups.
